ACT
10
Right of representation
The part of the estate that would have belonged to the predeceased child if he had survived the testator is inherited by his children, the testator's grandchildren, in equal parts, and if one of the grandchildren died before the testator, then the part that would have belonged to him if he had been alive at the time of the testator's death is inherited by his children , great-grandchildren of the testator, in equal parts, and so on in order as long as there are descendants of the testator.
